text: Gruffudd ap Dafydd Goch was a Welsh knight of the 14th century. He lived in Y Fedw Deg, Penmachno and was foreman of the Nantconwy jury that gave evidence to the Crown for the extent of 1352. His stone effigy may be found in the old Church of St. Michael, Betws-y-Coed. He was the son of Dafydd Goch, the father of Gruffudd Fychan ap Gruffudd ap Dafydd Goch and the grandfather of Gruffudd Leiaf. ==References== Category:Welsh knights
title: Gruffudd ap Dafydd Goch
